createConfigChannel

public static ConfigChannel createConfigChannel(Org org,
                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.String label,
                                                ConfigChannelType type)
Creates a test configuration channel and saves it to the database with the given information. Note: does not flush hibernate. Note2: users of the same org do not automatically have access to this channel. Use the giveUserChanAccess method to accomplish that.

Parameters:
org - The org
name - The channel name
label - The channel label
type - The channel type (from ConfigurationFactory constant types)
Returns:
The newly created ConfigChannel

public static ConfigRevision createConfigRevision(ConfigFile file,

                                                  ConfigInfo info,
                                                  java.lang.Long revision)
Creates a test configuration revision and saves it to the database with the given information. Note: does not flush hibernate. Note2: users of the same org do not automatically have access to this revision. See rhn_config_channel.get_user_revision_access

Parameters:
file - The file for this revision to belong to.
content - The content of this revision.
info - Permissions and file information.
revision - The revision number.
Returns:
The newly created ConfigRevision

giveUserChanAccess

public static Server giveUserChanAccess(User user,
                                        ConfigChannel channel)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
This method will give a user access to a channel (as dictated by the database function rhn_config_channel.get_user_chan_access). This method will create a server for the given user and subscribe that server to the given config channel as long as both the channel and the user belong to the same org. Alternatively, if you don't wish to create a server for the user, giving the user config_admin or org_admin status will also give them acces to the config channel. Note: Giving access to config files and config revisions is done the same way. Just give the user access the channel and they will have access to all files and revisions in that channel. (satisfying rhn_config_channel.get_user_*_access)

Parameters:
user - The user to be given access.
channel - The channel for which to give access.
Returns:
The server created and subscribed to the config channel.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - yep.

giveOrgQuota

public static void giveOrgQuota(Org org)
Creating revisions requires org quota because they take up quota. This must be called before creating a revision, but it need only be called once.

Parameters:
org - The org we are giving quota.

giveConfigCapabilities

public static void giveConfigCapabilities(Server server)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Gives all the config capabilites to a server

Parameters:
server - the server that you want to be config enabled
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - In the case of DB errors or sql exceptions.
